intro: Tabernaemontana tetrastachya, commonly known as the four-stamen tabernaemontana, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apocynaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers are pollinated primarily by birds, especially sunbirds, due to their bright colors and nectar-rich structure.
